jsonLD.author: Madeline Miller
jsonLD.description: <b>This #1 <i>New York Times </i>bestseller is a "bold and subversive retelling of the goddess's story" that brilliantly reimagines the life of Circe, formidable sorceress of The Odyssey (Alexandra Alter, <i>The</i><i>New York Times</i>).</b><br /><br /> In the house of Helios, god of the sun and mi‚Ä¶
jsonLD.name: Circe

review.author: alnicnireader
review.name: Amazing Audiobook
review.reviewBody: This book is beautifully written. The voice actor, Perdita Weeks, makes the audiobook so enjoyable. She voices the characters distinctly without throwing the listener off. Very well done!

review.author: Saraswati5
review.name: Circe
review.reviewBody: Wonderful.  Brought arch types to life in a meaningful way. Beautifully read and evocative.

review.author: izdirita
review.name: Still one of my favorite novels ever.
review.reviewBody: My second reading and another 5 stars. Truly a perfect narrative with such lyrical prose it feels as though it were written out of time. The themes and lessons of Circe are as timeless as the myths themselves, yet ever more potent in as time goes on. Madeline Miller has indeed succeeded in providing the world with an Odyssey tale, much fuller than its predecessor and with infinitely more wisdom of human nature and the dark night of the soul. Oh to be witch of Aiaia.

review.author: Dakotasaxton
review.name: The new rules are expected by mid September or

review.author: wineg1rl
review.name: My favorite book in the whole world
review.reviewBody: I first read this book during a really challenging time of my life. I saw it on the shelf and I was immediately drawn to it. I needed Circe. I related to her so much and found myself inspired and empowered by her and her story. I love this adaptation so much. I love Circe and thank you Madeline Miller!!! The audiobook is even better, just because the narrator is amazing and I just love hearing someone else reading her story.

review.author: piblett_
review.name: highly recommend
review.reviewBody:
i‚Äôve listened to this so many times and still feel entertained, i often think of this wonderful book and recommend it to anyone even if they aren‚Äôt familiar with greek mythology. 

i‚Äôve even found myself daydreaming of what it would be like to fall in love with a greek goddess, or even be one because of this beautiful book.

review.author: Will47Ensign7
review.name: More please
review.reviewBody: One of the best books ever

review.author: Bakeneko21
review.name: A fresh take on Greek mythology, absolutely inspiring!
review.reviewBody: What a please to read this was! Circe communicates her feelings within a fantastical world in such a way that you long to become more than an espectador, but are too afraid to engage more, for it all feels so very plausible. For any genre lover, definitely worth a read!
